article.headline: Alabama A&amp,M 94, Grambling St. 61
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. (AP) -- Trant Simpson and Desmond Jackson each scored 15 points for Alabama A&M and the Bulldogs forced 30 turnovers en route to a 94-61 Southwestern Athletic Conference win on Monday night. The Tigers (0-9, 0-2) had trouble holding onto the ball in the opening minutes and Alabama A&M (4-8, 1-1) quickly took advantage as the Bulldogs claimed a 20-6 lead seven minutes into the game. Grambling cut the deficit to 11 on two occasions over the next five minutes but Alabama A&M strongly closed out the half, outscoring the Tigers 23-16. Alabama A&M led at the half, 53-35. Joining Simpson and Jackson in double figures were Evan Hilton, who had 12 and John Smith added 11. Duran Diaz, a freshman who came off the bench, led Grambling with 14 points while Andrew Prestley chipped in 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
